key_points: Tom Brady advises his Tampa Bay Buccaneers teammates to get used to winning following Super Bowl LV win.
Brady left a comment on Antoine Winfield Jr.'s Instagram post showcasing his new Super Bowl tattoo, saying 'Make sure you leave some room'.
The tattoo features the team's logo on the Lombardi Trophy with raised hands in prayer.
Brady, at 43, won his seventh championship and first with the Buccaneers earlier this month.
This victory marked Brady's 10th championship appearance and he was named Super Bowl LV MVP.
Brady is the oldest NFL player to participate in a championship game.
Despite retirement questions, Brady plans to continue playing and could see himself on the field past 45.
He claims football is more than just a sport to him, embracing its physical, mental, and emotional aspects.
Brady emphasizes teamwork, stating, 'It's never about what I do, it's really about what we do.'
Brady suggests having a hard time walking away from football when the time comes.
spokespersons: Antoine Winfield Jr. (Safety, Tampa Bay Buccaneers)
